issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
Especially in our examples. I traced the problem down to the bundled styles. Given that most likely our users use them too, we better fix that in the code rather than working around with runner changes.

Of course, runner changes are possible - we can insert the stylesheets statically and use noStyle. This will be a (relatively) large change, though. 

Niall note: Have discussed this with Petyo. The problem with Async initialisation of the grid is that the API will not work when grid constructor returns (because constructor returns before API is ready to accept calls). This will be easier to manage after we separate the UI from the services (another JIRA). In that case, we could initialise the services and model immediately, and then have the UI initialise asynchronously, that way the user will be able to call the API straight away (assuming it's a non UI function, but it's most probable people will want to set sort order or selection after grid created, and not eg refresh UI).

fields.description:
The example is in Angular, but  I dont think thats very significant here

Look at the output in the plunker - the detail component is created many times, but this doesn't happen when auto row height is off
fields.customfield_10522:
With domLayout=normal each row as a specific top pixel position. This is set using style.transform:translateY(px). With this mechanism, the grid is in full control of the position of the rows and just updates the top pixel position when the row position changes.

On the other hand when domLayout=autoHeight is used, then the grid lays the rows out using normal browser flow. This means the grid does not set a top pixel position, it just provides the rows to the browser and the browser lays them out one after the other like layout out a normal web page.

You can observe this by inspecting the dom for each.

This technique is what allows the grid to auto-fit the height to match the rows.

Adding rows to the end of the list would be fine, as you could just add rows to the bottom. However, if anything happens that changes the order of the list (sort, filter, or a generic transaction update) then the order of the DOM elements is wrong and a full redraw has to happen for it to be fixed.

To change the layout of autoHeight to use the same technique as the normal layout is not a quick fix.
fields.summary: [domLayout] Grid option domLayout set to autoHeight causes detail component to be instantiated many times

fields.description:
Sometimes the detail grid gridReady event is fired _before_ the grid is actually rendered (meaning that columns cant be resized in that event)
 
I think we need some sort of re-check mechanism in the core that checks if the grid has been rendered before gridReady
